GBP - Individual Market Analysis

CoT signals and diagnostics for GBP futures.

As of 2025-11-04

Gemini Summary

State of the Market Summary:

  • The British Pound futures market shows speculators holding net short positions at -20.30% of Open Interest [Source: GBP_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Hedgers are significantly net long at 24.70% of Open Interest, indicating deep long pressure [Source: GBP_CoT_Signals.html].
  • A -18.50% long reduction occurred in speculative positions over four weeks, as price reached 0.7613 [Source: GBP_CoT_Signals.html].
  • The most extreme condition is the hedgers' persistent deep long regime, active since July 2025 [Source: Hedger_Pressure_Indicator.html].

Technical Summary:

  • Speculative positioning shows a stretched short z-score of -1.92, approaching extreme levels [Source: GBP_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Hedger positioning reflects a stretched long z-score of 1.91, also nearing extreme values [Source: GBP_CoT_Signals.html].
  • A significant divergence between speculators and hedgers is present [Source: Specs_vs_Hedgers_Divergence_Reversal_Risk.html].
  • No crowding, squeeze, or exhaustion risk flags are active for the latest report date [Source: Squeeze_Exhaustion_Risk.html].

References:

  • British Pound CoT Signals (`df_gbp_signal`), latest data 2025-11-04 [Source: GBP_CoT_Signals.html]. Net %OI, z-scores, and 4w flow were most influential.
  • Daily GBP/USD spot prices (e.g., via yfinance) for higher-frequency price context.
  • UK macroeconomic indicators (e.g., CPI, BoE interest rates) for fundamental analysis.
